CONFERENCE NOTES
Registration Procedure. The Institute Registration desk will be located in the
lobby of the Deshler-Wallick Hotel. Advance registrants, however, will obtain
their tickets and badges at the WCOL Information Center near the registration desk.
The general registration fee is $5.00, which includes a copy of the proceedings,
Education on the Air, 1947 (separately priced at $3.50), and admission to all meet¬
ings. General registration for wives of members attending is $3.00; single-session
registration is $.75; and general registration for students is $1.00. These latter regis¬
trations admit persons to the meetings, but do not include a copy of the proceedings.
General registrants will be admitted to all meetings by badge; single-session regis¬
trants must present tickets. Students in high schools and colleges will be required to
present fee cards or other evidence of school membership when requesting student
registrations.
The Institute for Education by Radio is a cooperative conference maintained
through the interest and support of its members. The Ohio State University grants
a small allotment to cover a portion of the expense, but the bulk of the cost for
this annual meeting and for the printing of the proceedings is supplied by con¬
ference registration fees. The Institute pays neither honoraria nor expenses for its
speakers, and it is the custom, in furtherance of the cooperative character of the
meeting, for speakers and chairmen to pay registration fees on the same basts as
other participants.
Annual Institute Dinner. Tickets for the dinner, Sunday evening, May 4, if
not purchased in advance, may be obtained at the registration desk; the price is
$3.50. All reservations for the dinner must be made by Sunday noon, May 4. Dress
will be informal.
Official Conference Proceedings. Each year the proceedings of the Institute are
published under the title, Education on the Air. The yearbooks may be purchased
at $3.50 a copy from Ohio State University, except the 1935 yearbook which is
available from the University of Chicago Press. There was no conference in 1945,
because of wartime travel conditions, so no yearbook was published for that year.
Issues for 1930, 1940 and 1941 are out of print. A reduced price for back copies
is made when they are purchased in sets. A set of the proceedings of past years is
on display at the conference registration desk.
•
All meetings are scheduled on Eastern Standard Time.
Open discussion on matters of radio education is one of the chief functions of
the Institute. Members are urged to take part freely in discussion.
•
The exchange of materials among the members of the Institute has proved
helpful in the past. Tables will be provided outside Institute headquarters on the
second floor where this material may be placed. Members are encouraged to bring
such materials for distribution.
